column3: Here is the clean and red-lined version of section 1.
Have you spoken to Andy's book accountant?
Paul,If you are coming to Houston for bidweek would you give my group a quick presentation on future rockies expansions?  Please let me know and I will set up a conference room if you can do it.
My map was blank.  Could you resend?

Brandon-  I talked to the Human Resource rep. They told me if the head of gas control can find something for you to do we could  bring you on. The head of gas control, Patty Sullivan, has been out all week so hopefully I should know something next week.
brandon, just looked at your email. I'll check into interns.
Of the 45,000 we sold 22,000 was not able to get scheduled by the timely nom.  With problems at Kemmerer, this volume is vulnerable to cuts.  Any more thought on how this problem can be resolved?

Andy, Thanks for taking the time in reading the posting agreement and making comments.  It is worth remembering that given a choice we would not be entering into this posting agreement.    The historical agreement with MG dictates many of the variances we will see from your other posting agreements.

You are my PRC Rep this year. I would like to drop by to introduce myself and brief you on my roles and responsibilities. Please let me know what would be a good time for you. I think 15-20 minutes should be enough.

After a week and a half of silence from Houston Street, I found out today that they have taken over responsibility for their exchange linking development from Sapient.  According to the Houston Street project manager, Sapient was being too cautious and thorough in their efforts to get to market and Houston Street wasn't impressed with their progress to date.
Attached is the trade count for Nov 28, 2000 sorted by Country, Commodity and Category.If you have any questions call me at 3-6460

column2: Re: Price Posting Agreement and Side Letter for Review - eMetra
column3: fyi only - understand that you and Bruce have discussed many of the points below with Justin already.

Andy, do we have any intention of doing any integration with Tradespark at this time?  If we do I will get more involved in this otherwise we will just let the infrastructure team continue to run with this.
Following further discussions, I attach a new draft of the document.  As before, this is subject to further internal Enron review, and has not been circulated to any other parties.
Below are a number of the e-mail's that I've exchanged with TrueQuote.  I can't say that they make for interesting reading but if you note any potential issues please let me know.
Thanks for your note.  I hope that things are going well for you at EBS.  I know that it must be busy.
The promotional memo came out a couple of hours too late for me to be able to mention it to you on the phone this afternoon.  Congratulations on your promotion to Managing Director.

No memo out yet on the Doorstep process.  I am still in the throws of completing the 13 reviews that I have to give - should be finished by 5:00.  I will send the memo on Doorstep process to you, Fernley and Michael Brown before I leave for the day. I will be in the Calgary office Wednesday and Thursday with Peggy Hedstrom and her team.  Back in the Houston office on Friday.

column2: Benchmark against other companies offering back-office services
column3: I was out of the office Friday and Monday - just back today.  I am having to rearrange some things that Mary was focused on.  I will get back with you later today and let you know who the best contact person will be.

Resume attached per my voice mail to you.  This guy is currently at Compaq, but wants to do something else.  Any interest?  As I said in my voice mail, I will be glad to call my friend Dave Schempf to get more info on this guy if you would like.

We didn't really cover the role you intended to play with EES and EBS as far as Doorstep is concerned when we met with Causey/Buy.  (Or I just can't remember.) May we include EES and EBS in the scope of our one Doorstep project, and continue to work with Shona, also coordinating with Wanda and Barry when EES and EBS are involved?

I guess you know I am here in London this week wrapping up -- wish I could be there for this meeting.Are you still coming next week?   It would be good to get together.  Let me know  -- I will try to call this afternoon
FYI:  As I mentioned, I am staying in the Four Seasons next week.  The hotel is located at Hamilton Place Park Lane.  I thought the location might mean something to you.
I just noticed your name on the list of new MD's.  Congratulations on achieving heights that few people reach!  You are an inspiration to many.

Summer Analysts will benefit from our recent compensation changes.  Their monthly salary this summer will be $3333.00 Please let me know if you have any questions. Thank you, and I look forward to seeing you in Austin Monday.

I have been out of the office at the Orange Bowl game and have just returned within the last hour.  That probably would make next week better for me than this week.  Give me a call and we will set something up.  My number is x35926.  If you don't reach me, call my temp assistant (Camella - x39106) and she will be able to set  up a meeting.  Thanks.
Thanks for your note.  Yes, this definitely starts the year off nicely.  Hope your holidays were wonderful and that 2001 is a good year for you and your family, too.
okay, sistas - we're in at Josephine's on June 2.   They're faxing me info on it; we can look it over and commit if we like what we see.  I'll keep you posted.

Saturday was fun - it was nice I think for all of us to go to the shower together.  That was a nice group of women - and fun.  Cara did tell me about the scrapbook idea and I think that it sounds good. Tell me what I can do to help you, but I am probably shorter on time than anything.  But if I can get you get addresses or whatever, let me know.

Just a word of thanks for setting up the interviews last week.  I was thoroughly impressed with the groups and saw several areas which I would like to explore further.  I will be following up with Beth Apollo, Brenda Herod and Brent Price to explore opportunities in their areas.
Thanks for the note regarding Gordon.  I appreciate the quick turnaround time on it, and I agree that he should be a helpful addition to the team.Put me down as a fan of the doorstop review process.
Thanks for your list.  I will add these to our Hot List.  Let me know about the A/R.  Thanks.  Would love to hear about your trip in more detail.
FYI - here is accountings response to the MTM Difference on 20Q.  Chris edited my roll of MTM to explain the difference we had for July close.

When I put the changes in TIS, the total RTA changes from (8,562,517) to (13,717,606).  The change of (5.1) million is not what Robbie passed along to me as the expected change.  Do those numbers sound correct?

can I get together with you guys for a few minutes to discuss some customer offsite alternatives, Our group is in the early stages of planning a function with invited guests ( 10 guests, 6 staff).  I am interested in locations ( recomendations ), your roles and responsibilities in pulling this together, total cost ( value ) timelines.

I will get you guys some names on people that i would like this to go to. Can you re-send to me the distribution list including contact name, e-mail address, sorted by business group.Industrials, Muni's, Untilities, Producers, Other
I don't know if I sent you a note on this already but pls postpone install date until further notice. I am unavailable for the rest of the week.

I'm sorry I haven't replied sooner, but there is a decision to be made about what type of product these should fall under...Gas Daily, or Basis.  We're afraid that if we categorize them as Gas Daily, then anyone who logs onto the site looking for basis would miss these products altogether.

Robyn Menear is my new assistant on the FT-Central book.  I'd like to have her set up to use EOL stack manager, product manager, and transact on the website.  I believe she already has a login ID for the website, but I don't know about the others.
Thanks Julie!  Looking forward to a great new year!
